spans.text: The joint practice after several months came to an end awkwardly.
Sitting on the train, Taki felt extremely upset.
She felt that today's practice session had ended unhappily entirely because of her.
—Her body was letting her down, she couldn't produce a decent song, and she was so unreasonable...
Even though she knew her teammates were concerned about her, she blurted out a bunch of spiteful words...
The train car was empty, which suited Taki perfectly.
She didn't want anyone to see her frowning face.

The sun was shining brightly outside the train window. Although noon had passed, the light piercing through the thin clouds was still dazzling and somewhat scorching. It was truly an untimely weather.
The heat licked Taki's arm, but it didn't elicit even a trace of reaction from her.
She was as still as if she had been embedded in the train window.
A myriad of thoughts, like tangled vines, wrapped around her heart, binding it tightly.
(I know, everyone has things to be busy with, and I also know the fact that the band is no longer the top priority.)
(But why, why can everyone act so indifferent?)
(It was supposed to be a long-awaited reunion... why did it turn out like this...)
The train arrived at the station, and the female voice on the loudspeaker seemed to be urging her to leave quickly.
